title: Brazil’s Crisis of Memory: Embracing Myths and Forgetting History with Paulo Simões
itunes:title: Brazil’s Crisis of Memory: Embracing Myths and Forgetting History with Paulo Simões
description: In this episode of the Latin American Perspectives podcast, Alexander Scott, Outreach Coordinator for Latin American Perspectives, discusses the themes, context and meaning of the July 2019 issue, "Brazil’s Crisis of Memory: Embracing Myths and Forgetting History" with LAP Coordinating Editor and resident Brazilian, Paulo Simões.
content:encoded: In this episode of the Latin American Perspectives podcast, Alexander Scott, Outreach Coordinator for Latin American Perspectives, discusses the themes, context and meaning of the July 2019 issue, "Brazil’s Crisis of Memory: Embracing Myths and Forgetting History" with LAP Coordinating Editor and resident Brazilian, Paulo Simões.
itunes:subtitle: Latin American Perspectives Podcast Series
